title: God in Islam
summary: God in Islam (Arabic: ٱللَّٰه‎, romanized: Allāh, contraction of ٱلْإِلَٰه al-Ilah, lit. "the God")[1] is the eternal Supreme Being who created and preserves all things.[1][2][3][4] In Islam, God is conceived as absolutely one, unique, and perfect, free from all faults, deﬁciencies, and defects, and further held to be omnipotent, omniscient, and completely infinite in all of his attributes, who has no partner or equal, being the sole creator of everything in existence.[1][2][4][5] Islam emphasizes that God is strictly singular, all-merciful and all-compassionate, whose mercy embraces everything;[6] who neither slumbers nor sleeps, nor is obnoxious to decay nor death.[7][8]
